pullRequest.title: Issue #8308: need to introduce "id" rule (#8023)
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue #8308: need to introduce "id" rule to solve keyword as identifier problem.
Per discussion at #8308, in order to solve the "keyword as identifier" problem, which is introduced by the inclusion of the "records" feature of Java 14, we need to add this rule to Checkstyle's grammar.  Please see Check and AST regression reports here: #8308 (comment)

beforeCommit.message: Issue #8308: need to introduce "id" rule to solve keyword as identifier problem

afterCommit.message: Issue #8308: need to introduce "id" rule to solve keyword as identifier problem

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -501,9 +501,9 @@ annotationMemberValuePairs
     ;
 
 annotationMemberValuePair!
-    :   i:IDENT a:ASSIGN v:annotationMemberValueInitializer
+    :   id:id a:ASSIGN v:annotationMemberValueInitializer

nodes.bodyText: Does this need to be named, or could it just be “id” by itself?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -545,7 +545,7 @@ annotationExpression
 
 // Definition of a Java class
 classDefinition![AST modifiers]
-    :    c:"class" IDENT
+    :    c:"class" id:id

@@ -565,33 +565,33 @@ superClassClause
 
 // Definition of a Java Interface
 interfaceDefinition![AST modifiers]
-    :    i:"interface" IDENT
+    :    i:"interface" id:id

@@ -696,13 +696,13 @@ enumBlock
 //a body
 enumConstant!
     :   an:annotations
-        i:IDENT
+        id:id

@@ -805,7 +805,7 @@ implementsClause
 
                        |
                        t:typeSpec[false]  // method or variable declaration(s)
-                       (    IDENT  // the name of the method
+                       (    id:id  // the name of the method
